thread.title: Royals, Mets World Series schedule
thread.title_full: Royals, Mets World Series schedule - KCTV5

author: DeAnn Smith, Digital Content Manager
title: Royals, Mets World Series schedule
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - The Fall Classic will feature two expansion teams.
The Kansas City Royals return after falling just short last year against the Giants. The New York Mets return for the first time since 2000.
The American League, led by manager Ned Yost and other Royals players, won the All-Star Game, giving the Royals home-field advantage.
All the games will be at 7:07 p.m. except for Game 5. If that game is necessary, first pitch will be 7:15 p.m.
The World Series opens Tuesday at Kauffman. Game 2 is Wednesday at the K.
The teams head to New York. Game 3 is Friday while Game 4 is on Halloween night.
If a Game 5 is necessary, it will be Sunday, Nov. 1. If necessary, the teams will return to Kauffman for Games 6 and 7 on Nov. 3 and Nov. 4.
All games will be on Fox.
The Mets won the World Series in 1969 and 1986. The Royals won in 1985.
The last time these two teams played each other was 2013. The two teams will meet again on Opening Day at Kauffman Stadium next April.
